text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 3_Comment: And in the morning, proclaim Their unity
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 6_Comment: Bet On your corners, perpetual tzitzit,
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 7_Comment: And on your doorways, eternal mezuza.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 9_Comment: Fear them, as God has given them greatness.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 12_Comment: And uphold fear towards the Temple.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 15_Comment: And the ruler must read it to the nation, to uphold it.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 18_Comment: And treasure your neighbor like yourself.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 21_Comment: And uphold the justness of your weights.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 22_Comment: Hey Surely raise up [a fallen animal]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 24_Comment: And surely lend what is needed.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 26_Comment: Surely give gifts [to a freed slave]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 28_Comment: Vav And your brother may live with you
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 29_Comment: And bless with joyful song when you are satisfied.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 30_Comment: Surely circumcise those born to your household
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 31_Comment: And those you purchase, for a covenant of remembrance.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 36_Comment: And your animals must rest on it.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 38_Comment: And seventh of the Nissan [holiday, i.e. Passover]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 40_Comment: And the Shofar-blowing [holiday, i.e. Rosh Hashana] - to specify them for sanctity.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 41_Comment: Chet Sanctify the laws of Kippurim
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 43_Comment: And the eighth day of it.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 45_Comment: And with gifts of your hand, as Their goodness has blessed.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 49_Comment: To clear out leaven, and to destroy it.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 57_Comment: And completing celebration of the holidays.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 59_Comment: And candles on the days of Chanukah, until they are completed.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 60_Comment: Kaf At the completion of six years, let the land rest
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 61_Comment: And in them, seek any Jewish slave who was taken.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 62_Comment: The fiftieth year, and fallow it
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 63_Comment: And even the [slave] with a pierced ear will be freed then.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 65_Comment: And the "first fruits" of your kneading trough [challah]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 67_Comment: But you must return a collateral object that [the borrower] needs, and you will be blessed in all transactions.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 68_Comment: Mem Acquisition by money, contract, and intercourse - through them will you gain control of a wife.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 71_Comment: And periodic intimacy, while she remains
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 72_Comment: And divorce when she leaves, to separate.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 73_Comment: Nun If you long for a beautiful [war captive], convert her
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 74_Comment: And differentiate between a Sotah and a rebellious one.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 75_Comment: Do chalitza or yibum for your yevama, perhaps a remnant can be raised up.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 76_Comment: Samech To prevent the remnant from falling, place a fence [on a roof]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 77_Comment: And redeem the first issue of any womb when it opens.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 78_Comment: And the [first] offspring of your animals must be sanctified
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 79_Comment: And the property must be redeemed or butchered.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 80_Comment: Ayin When time comes to tie the first fruits, sanctify them without anger.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 83_Comment: Peh If the first fruits have developed, offer them
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 87_Comment: And tithes for the downtrodden poor.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 88_Comment: Tzadi March the second tithe to the chosen place, or redeem it and its monetary value will be sanctified.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 89_Comment: And confess when you uphold all these 'I have cleared out all the sacred tithes.'
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 90_Comment: Kuf Your first shearing is sacred
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 91_Comment: And your sacrifices get four placements [of blood on the altar]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 92_Comment: You must investigate properly the laws of slaughter
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 94_Comment: Resh If your borders are wide and you want [meat], fatten My goodness and be satisfied.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 96_Comment: When the seven faces are investigating. Shin These ninety-seven positive commandments you must always complete. Since they are personal mitzvot, study them and sing of their delicacy. Tav Your good yield, which I have hidden, I made for those who take refuge, saying, "If you walk in my ways, keeping my rules and laws."
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 97_Comment: Tav Guard what [speech] leaves your lips
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 99_Comment: And specify them, to estrange voluntarily.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 100_Comment: Bring sacrifices if you [a nazir] become suddenly impure
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 101_Comment: And for your completed nazir ritual, for triumph.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 102_Comment: Shin A carefree girl's oaths and prohibitions are her father's
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 103_Comment: And her husband, the silly one.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 104_Comment: To the place where I choose, bring My sacrifices willingly.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 105_Comment: Resh Desirable from the eighth day [of age]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 111_Comment: And the forty loaves for the expected thanksgiving-offering.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 112_Comment: Kuf To wave the fatty sacrifices
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 113_Comment: The breast and thigh go to those who serve with love.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 114_Comment: To burn the remainder in the morning
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 115_Comment: The burnt-offering's hide goes to the priestly troops.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 119_Comment: Loaves and its wafers, to be evaluated.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 122_Comment: And dividing the meal-offerings, you must follow.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 123_Comment: Peh The breadcrumbs for the pans
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 125_Comment: And the property of the priestly watch that is blessing.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 128_Comment: And clearing out the worthy firewood.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 129_Comment: Ayin The valuation of each person's life according to their age
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 130_Comment: And the animals that may not be brought to the Sanctuary.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 132_Comment: And the one-fifth [penalty] for their owners,
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 134_Comment: And those purchased - to redeem them.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 135_Comment: Samech The communal goat offerings for idolatry
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 136_Comment: And for the individual - to bring them.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 139_Comment: And the sin-offering over what is concealed.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 140_Comment: Nun Something concealed from the public
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 141_Comment: And the anointed [High Priest] must bring a bull
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 142_Comment: And the chief must atone with a goat.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 145_Comment: And with a tenth-ephah [of flour] to be beautified.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 147_Comment: And a thief must repay the balance and a fifth, and their mistake will be canceled with a guilt-offering.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 150_Comment: And atoning for using consecrated items with a fifth of their value.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 151_Comment: Lamed To atone for what touches a sin-offering
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 152_Comment: And that its blood on any object is subject to the rules of the unblemished [offering].
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 153_Comment: The Levites must donate from their tithe to those [priests] who serve the Ruler inside.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 154_Comment: Kaf "Thus shall you bless" - and this is your rule, 85 commandments in total.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 155_Comment: And priests must separate themselves from a corpse
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 156_Comment: Only for their closest may they become impure.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 157_Comment: Yud One becomes impure from clean animal carcasses - one who touches
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 159_Comment: And one who eats, according to the law.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 160_Comment: And one who touches something impure
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 162_Comment: And one who touches vermin directly.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 167_Comment: And seeds as they are juiced.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 168_Comment: An oven or stove must be smashed,
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 169_Comment: To learn the laws of a spring and cistern.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 170_Comment: Chet The laws of seeing semen
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 172_Comment: And for one's bedmate, not to be mixed up.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 177_Comment: And her sexual partner, they are warned.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 181_Comment: And two weeks are counted for those who give birth.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 184_Comment: And to bring a sacrifice and to instruct...
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 185_Comment: Vav And to instruct on the appearance of the bright skin flesh [tzaraat]
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 186_Comment: And the connected laws about healing.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 193_Comment: For the rich who are purified
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 196_Comment: And purifying them, so that the devout may inherit them.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 197_Comment: Dalet Those who cling to the dead must be purified on the third and seventh day, as is written about them.
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 198_Comment: The one who sprinkles the water for impurity must launder
text.0_Positive Commandments, 0_, 199_Comment: And similarly one who touches them becomes impure. Gimel Concluded are the forty five commandments about separating impurity, not to approach it. Included were one hundred and three priestly commandments, which are intertwined with them. Bet Among them were included the first set, in total two hundred practices. Aleph These are the positive commandments that the lofty Sages discussed.
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 0_Comment: Aleph. Other gods- do not have them
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 4_Comment: And you must not bring an abomination [idol]
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 6_Comment: And your mouth must not be heard to mention them.
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 7_Comment: Bet. Do not implement an Ashera
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 9_Comment: Or a bowing-stone for their sake.
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 10_Comment: Do not eat from their sacrifices
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 11_Comment: And do not follow the customs of their nations.
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 12_Comment: Gimel. Their [Canaanite] nations- do not make treaties with them
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 13_Comment: And be careful not to intermarry with them.
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 17_Comment: And be warned away from their unreliability.
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 24_Comment: And be unfamiliar with consulting the dead.
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 30_Comment: Hey. Restrict yourselves from swearing unnecessarily
text.1_Negative Commandments, 1_, 32_Comment: And do not profane the Lord's name...
